page.title: 11CHURCHES IN ST.MARTINS
page.content: {St.Martins Church}is{800}years old. Inside the church, the{walls}are sloping.It was built like this to remind us of the Ark.Another symbol is that the main{aisle}slopes from the west door right up to the Altar steps. The slope reminds us of the ascent to Calvary.There was a{Jacobean,}oak, three decker pulpit.It is not used but is still in the church.On a{Sunday morning about{30 people}come to {worship.}During the evening only{20 attend. {The Methodist Church}in{St.Martins}is not very decorative.There are between {30 to 35}regular attenders.A playgroup use a room in the church and meet on Monday,Wednesday and Friday from 9a.m. to 12 noon.On Wednesday evenings eight children meet for confirmation classes.
